screen_desc: The screenshot shows the settings menu on an Android phone. It displays various options like "Location," "Security" (with screen lock and fingerprint options), "Accounts" (linked to Google), "Accessibility" (for screen readers and interaction controls), and "Google" (services and preferences). The current settings indicate that 4 apps have access to the phone's location. There are also icons representing each setting for quick identification.
history_actions: click on the Settings icon located at the upper left.

think_action.Thought: The current screen is within the Settings menu. To change the appearance of the keyboard, the user needs to navigate to the 'Language & Input' settings or directly into the 'Keyboard' settings, which might be under the 'System' section. The next step is to locate and select the relevant section to modify the keyboard's look.
Future Action Plan: Scroll up to locate 'System' or 'Language & Input' settings
Select the 'Language & Input' or relevant keyboard settings
think_action.Next Single Step Action: Scroll up to locate the 'System' section
